newsitem.title: TAIWAN: TAIWAN CENTRAL BANK SAYS INJECTING FUNDS.
newsitem.headline: TAIWAN CENTRAL BANK SAYS INJECTING FUNDS.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank, responding to recent tight liquidity in the money market, said it would inject funds into the banking system on Saturday.

A central bank official said the bank would execute open market operations on Saturday through repurchase of negotiable certificates of deposit, treasury bills, and government bonds offered by interested financial institutions.
The institutions have the option to repurchase the NCDs, treasury bills and bonds within 14 days, the official said.
The central bank said interested financial institutions should contact the bank by fax (886) 2-357-1992.
Bids would close at 10.30 a.m. (0230 GMT).
Funds would be released according to actual demand, the central bank said.
